オプション1: "Hold up. It's that Cube again," Star Man said to the children.

オプション1: Because they were carrying a stretcher, there were moments when they couldn’t avoid the monsters. Star Man and the others gently set the stretcher down on the ground.
The Cube stood motionless. Without a face, it was impossible to tell if it had noticed them.
Star Man raised his hand toward the Cube. A massive block of ice formed above it and came crashing down. The Cube partially shattered, and the ice melted into mist.
The Cube remained motionless. After taking a short break, Star Man repeated the same attack. The Cube was torn to pieces.
Trapezoid Man clapped as he said it, and Triangle Man followed his lead.
Rectangle Man cast his eyes downward.
There were no paths through the forest made for people—only whatever they could manage to squeeze through. Each time they ran into a monster, Star Man had to set the stretcher down and deal with it.
Trapezoid Man patted Star Man on the back.
Exhausted, they decided to rest. Trapezoid Man stood guard while the other three slept.
By the next afternoon, the three of them had woken up.
No one spoke, worn out from lack of sleep and fatigue. They shared the acorns they had brought during their escape and set out again.
